section.title: Wires and Transfers
section.para: Wires and Transfers module enables you to process single or cross-currency fund transfer transactions. In an international trade transaction, you can use the Wires and Transfers module to request a fund transfer for which the ordering bank can subsequently send an acknowledgement upon successful completion. You can inquire about the fund transfer records from the Account Activity menu in the Account Summary module.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Within this section of the help guide, the terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: Wires and Transfers Functions
section.para: The menu for this module has the following groups of functions. However, the Fund Transfers module is associated with a single event, that is, the submission of the transfer request and the bank's reply. Therefore, there are no functions to send amendments or free-format messages to the bank.

listitem.para: Create and submit a Fund Transfer (FT) request
Displays all the existing Fund Transfer requests that are not yet complete or have not been submitted.
Displays the existing FTs based on the specific search criteria.
Maintain unsigned, purged, and rejected FT transactions; update FT entities; and set references

section.title: FT Initiation
section.para: This section describes the Fund Transfer Initiation part of the menu and the forms it uses.

section.title: FT Initiation Functions
section.para:
This part of the menu contains several functions to create, maintain, and submit internal and external fund transfer requests.
FT Wires
Create, save, and submit a fund transfer request.
FT Transfers
Transfer funds between accounts with different currencies.
Edit Transactions
Review, modify, and submit the fund transfer records that are created and saved, but not submitted to the bank.
Retrieve Unsigned
Review and submit the fund transfer requests that have been created and submitted by the user, but have not been released to the bank because of insufficient privileges.

section.title: FT Initiation - FT Wires
section.para: The form displayed by the FT Wires function for initiating a fund transfer request is as follows. The FT Wires menu displays a fund transfer request form that can be used to create, save, and submit a fund transfer request. For more information about the form, refer to the FT Initiation - General Details section.

section.title: FT Wires - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the FT Spot function, from the tool bar, select Treasury Services > Wires and Transfers > FT Initiation, then select FT Wire from the side left navigation menu. The Create a Treasury External Fund Transfer page appears.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
Non-editable) Unique reference number generated by for the Fund Transfer trade when it is initiated. It is a non-editable, auto-generated, and sequential unique ID.
(Optional) Enter reference given by the customer for the trade. The data is saved in the database and not sent to the treasury back office. Maximum of 20 characters.
(Non-editable) Product code. By default, Fund Transfer is displayed.
(Non-editable) Date when when the Fund Transfer Initiation request was originally created. By Default, Application Date displays the current business date.

row.entry: Name and address of the applicant., and optionally the entity (within the applicant company) making the FT Spot application. The individual fields are described below.

(Editable) Entity mapped to the customer. This field is available only if your company has entities defined and you are attached to one or more entities. If you are attached to more than one entity, click the magnifying glass icon to select one. If you are attached to only one entity, the field is preset to that entity and cannot be changed. This field is hidden if there are no entities mapped to the customer. The magnifying glass icon displays all the entities mapped to the customer

entry.para: (Editable) Name of the entity. This field is available only if an Entity is selected. If Entity is not setup for a customer, then the customer name entered in the customer profile is displayed, by default.
(line 1)

(Editable) Address entered in the Charge Account Address tab for the Entity in Customer Maintenance by the administrator. If the Entity is not setup for a customer, then the address entered in the SWIFT tab of the Customer Profile is displayed. Maximum of 35 characters for each address field.

section.title: FT Wires - Bank Details - Issuing Bank

entry.para: Field
Type
Description

row.entry: Bank to which you want to send your FT Spot request. The individual fields are described below and are mandatory.

entry.para: Name of the bank. The dropdown list shows a list of banks associated with the customer profile. Customer can select any one value from the dropdown list.

(Mandatory)The reference under which the transaction should be recorded. Issuer's Reference indicates the description of the Customer Reference to which the Treasury Customer ID is mapped. The dropdown list shows the references that are defined for the above selected Bank.

section.title: Issuing Bank - Transfer Details
section.para: All the fields are mandatory.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
(Non-editable) Indicates the type of trade. This field displays Wire Transfer.

row.entry: Enter an account from which the fund can be debited for the fund transfer trade. The magnifying glass icon displays all the Call and Notice and settlement accounts setup in the treasury back office for the customer.
(Non-editable) Currency of the account specified in the Debit Account field

Enter the currency and the amount that needs to be transferred. You can either enter a currency code or select the payment currency from the magnifying glass icon. If an incorrect currency code is entered by the customer, then the following error message is displayed: Currency xxx is not defined as a valid currency. You can enter an amount in the Amount field. Numeric. An error message is displayed if the value entered is not numeric. Supports two places after decimal. If a value entered has more than two places after decimal, then the following error message is displayed: Value entered is not valid. If a value is entered in the Payment Currency Amount field, the Debit Account Currency field is disabled, otherwise it is enabled.
A decimal value is not a valid value for the JPY currency. You can click the magnifying glass icon to select the Payment currency from the existing list.

entry.para: Settlement date of the fund transfer request. Enter a specific date. The dropdown list displays the following values from the Value Date field: Days, Date, Months, Weeks, Years, CASH, SPOT, and TOM.

When you select any of the values, a blank field is displayed adjacent to the Request Date field. If you select Date, the adjacent field has a dropdown calendar to enable you to select the date. You can select the date from the calendar in the adjacent field. If you select Days, then you must specify a valid business day for the entered currency or currency pair. If you select SPOT, then value date is two business days from the current date. If you select CASH, then the value date is the current date. If you select TOM, the value date is one business day from the current date. If a date less than today is selected, then the following error message is displayed: Request Date must be greater than or equal to today. The value can be entered in date format or as a pre-defined period (For example, 6 Months or 2 Years).

section.title: Issuing Bank - Select Instructions

entry.para: Field
Type
Description

row.entry: (Optional) Select one of the following types of instruction: Bank Instructions or Free Format Instructions.

section.para: When the customer selects Bank Instructions, then the columns displayed in the Bank Instructions section are as follows. The values set in the treasury back office are displayed in this section.

section.title: Select Instructions - Bank Instructions

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
Selects the transaction record.
Currency of the Fund Transfer trade..
Account number if the settlement account is non-nostro otherwise the field is set to blank.
Type of instruction. Instruction ID can be: Standing or Usual.

Beneficiary of the payment transaction. This field displays the short name of the beneficiary if the Bank Identification Code (BIC). Beneficiary is the name of the beneficiary's bank or the financial institution where the payment is made.
SWIFT ID of the beneficiary
Settlement account number of the beneficiary.
Institution with which the beneficiary maintains the account. If the beneficiary bank BIC is defined, the bank short name associated with the BIC is displayed in this field.
SWIFT code that identifies the beneficiary bank.

section.para: Click the Lookup button in the last column to view the Optional Bank Details page, which provides additional details about the selected settlement instruction. The following additional details are displayed.

section.title: Bank Instructions - Optional Bank Details - Payment Beneficiary Details

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
SWIFT charges payee. Indicates whether the beneficiary (Beneficiary) or the applicant (Applicant) pays the charges, or whether the charges are shared (Shared) between them.
Name of the ordering customer.

para.guilabel: Ordering Customer Address, Ordering Customer Address 2, Ordering Customer Address 3

entry.para: Address of the ordering customer.
Account number of the ordering customer.
Field
Type
Description
Optional) BIC code or SWIFT ID of the intermediary bank.
(Optional) Name of the intermediary bank through whose account the funds are paid.

note.para: If a value is entered in the Intermediary Bank Name field, then the city, state, and country code values must be entered.

para.guilabel: Intermediary Bank Address, Intermediary Bank Address 2, Intermediary Bank 3

section.title: Optional Bank Details - Payment Details

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
(Optional) Transaction details such as reason of the payment to be sent to the beneficiary. If the payment details are not entered in the treasury back office, then the fields remain blank.

section.para: When the customer selects Free Format Instructions in the Bank Payment Instructions section, a confirmation message appears. Click Ok to confirm the selection. The Beneficiary Details section is displayed with the following information.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description

Customer's financial institution where payment is made. Maximum of 35 characters. Click the magnifying glass icon to select a beneficiary from the existing list of beneficiaries previously entered in the Beneficiary Master page in the Administration tab. This field is mandatory.
To select a Beneficiary Name using the magnifying glass icon:

listitem.para: Click the magnifying glass icon. A popup window with the list of beneficiary names appears.
To refine the beneficiary list, enter values in the Beneficiary Name, Entity, and Account fields. Click Search. The list of beneficiary appears
Select the required Beneficiary Name. The beneficiary details of the selected record are populated in the Beneficiary Details section.

entry.para: Address of the beneficiary. Maximum of 35 characters. This field is mandatory.
Address of the beneficiary. Maximum of 35 characters.
City and state of the beneficiary. Maximum of 32 characters. This field is mandatory.
Country of the beneficiary. Select the country from the magnifying glass icon. Maximum of 2 characters. This field is mandatory.
Settlement account number of the beneficiary. Maximum of 33 characters. This field is mandatory.

(Optional) SWIFT code or BIC code that identifies the beneficiary bank. Maximum of 11 characters. Note: You need to either specify a value in Beneficiary Bank BIC Code/SWIFT ID field or in the following fields: Beneficiary Bank, Beneficiary Bank Branch Name, Beneficiary Bank Address 1, Beneficiary Bank City/State, and Beneficiary Bank Country.
Name of the beneficiary bank receiving the transfer. Maximum of 35 characters. This field is mandatory.
(Optional) Branch name of the beneficiary bank. Maximum of 35 characters.
(Optional) Address of the beneficiary bank receiving the transfer. Maximum of the 35 characters.
Name of the city or state of the beneficiary bank. Maximum of 32 characters. This field is mandatory.
Country of the beneficiary bank. Select the country from the magnifying glass icon. Maximum of 2 characters. This field is mandatory.
To select a Beneficiary Bank Country using the magnifying glass icon:

listitem.para: Click the magnifying glass icon. The List of Countries popup window appears.
To refine the list of countries, enter values in the Name field. Click Search. The updated list appears.
Click the ISO Code of the required country. The selected country code is displayed in the Beneficiary Bank Country field.

entry.para: (Optional) Routing number, ABA, Telex of the beneficiary bank. Maximum of 33 characters.
(Optional) Name of the ordering customer. Maximum of 35 characters.
(Optional) Account number of the ordering customer. Maximum of 33 characters.
(Optional) Address of the ordering customer. Maximum of 33 characters.
(Optional) City and state of the ordering customer. Maximum of 32 characters.
(Optional) Country of the ordering customer. Select the country from the magnifying glass icon. Maximum of 2 characters.
To select a Ordering Customer Country using the magnifying glass icon:

listitem.para: Click the magnifying glass icon. The List of Countries popup window appears.
To refine the list of countries, enter values in the Name field. Click Search. The updated list appears.
Click the ISO Code of the required country. The selected country code is displayed in the Ordering Customer Country field.

note.para: The fields related to the ordering customer are configured only if the customer has permissions

entry.para: SWIFT charges payee. Indicates whether the beneficiary (Beneficiary) or the applicant (Applicant) pays the charges, or whether the charges are shared (Shared) between them. Valid options are: Applicant, Beneficiary, or Shared.
Field
Type
Description

(Optional) Name of the intermediary bank. Maximum of 35 characters. Note: If a value is entered in the Intermediary Bank Name field, then the city, state, and country code is mandatory to be entered.
(Optional) Address of the intermediary bank. Maximum of 35 characters.
(Optional) Country of the intermediary bank. Select the country from the magnifying glass icon.
To select an Intermediary Country using the magnifying glass icon:

listitem.para: Click the magnifying glass icon. The List of Countries popup window appears.
To refine the list of countries, enter values in the Name field. Click Search. The updated list appears.
Click the ISO Code of the required country. The selected country code is displayed in the Intermediate Bank Country field.

Type
Description

section.title: Action Buttons

entry.para: Name
Type
Description

row.entry: Saves the current fund transfer request. The record will be saved with a status of Incomplete and can be updated and finalized at a later time. The following message is displayed in : Your fund transfer FTxxxxxxxxxxxxxx has been successfully saved as a draft. Click the Review and print the transaction details link to view and print the confirmation. The Event Details, General Details, Bank Details, Applicant Details, and Transfer Details sections are displayed. You can retrieve the saved instructions from the Edit Transactions menu and edit the details entered and submit it at a later date. Note: The Settlement Details section is displayed only for the free-format instructions.

entry.para: Submits the fund transfer request to the bank. When you click Submit, the Deal Summary popup window is displayed with Accept and Reject buttons.
If you click:

listitem.para: Accept, a confirmation message indicating the submission of the specified data is displayed with Ok and Cancel buttons. Click Ok to submit the fund transfer request. If you have sufficient privileges, the fund transfer request is released to the bank. The Review and print the transaction details link is displayed. If you do not have sufficient privileges, the Submit Fund Transfer Initiation page appears, indicating that due to insufficient privileges, the request has been saved but not released to the bank and an authorized person can release the transaction. Click the Review and print the transaction details link to view and print the confirmation. For more information about the Review and print the transaction details link, refer the description provided for the Save button.
Reject, a confirmation message indicating that the request has been rejected is displayed. Click Ok to reject.

entry.para: When you submit a cross-currency wire transaction, displays a rate with the time period within which you must accept or reject the rate. Otherwise, the following error message is displayed: Deal has not been completed. Return to the entry screen to request a new rate. If you accept the rate within a specified time period and you have authorization to submit the cross-currency wire transaction, then a confirmation message is displayed indicating that the transaction has been successfully submitted to the bank with the Review and print the transaction details link. If you do not have sufficient privileges, the Submit Fund Transfer Initiation page appears, indicating that due to insufficient privileges, the request has been saved but not released to the bank and an authorized person can release the transaction. Click Review and print the transaction details to view and print the confirmation.

listitem.para: The balance amount is verified in the treasury back office if a Call and Notice account is specified in the Debit Account field. If sufficient amount is not available in the account to complete the requested transaction, then the following error message is displayed: Overdraft account not found.
If you submit a wire transaction without selecting the instructions, then an error message must be displayed indicating that the instructions must be selected.
The submission is not accepted after the specified payment hours.

entry.para: Cancels the creation of the fund transfer request. If Cancel is selected, the Treasury Fund Transfer Module Presentation page is displayed.
Displays an online help facility that describes the fields associated with the fund transfer record.

row.entry: Clears the details specified in the Bank Payment Instructions.

section.para: In the Review and print the transaction details popup window, use the following buttons to export, print, or close the confirmation.

entry.para: Name
Type
Description

row.entry: Saves a confirmation in PDF format.

entry.para: Closes the confirmation window.

section.title: FT Initiation - FT Transfers
section.para: The FT Transfers menu displays a fund transfer request form that can be used to request a cross-currency fund transfer. For information about General Details, Bank Details, and actions buttons in the form, refer to the FT Initiation - FT Wires section. The Transfer Details are described in the FT Transfers - Transfer Details section below.

section.title: FT Transfers - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the FT Transfers menu, select Treasury services > Wires and Transfer > FT Initiation > FT Transfers from the side left navigation menu. The Create a Treasury Internal Fund Transfer page with a form to imitate both single and cross-currency fund transfer is displayed.

section.title: FT Transfers - Transfer Details
section.para: All the fields are mandatory.

entry.para: Field
Type
Description
(Non-editable) Indicates the type of trade. This field displays Wire Transfer.

row.entry: (Non-editable) Currency of the account specified in the Debit Account field

Enter an account to which funds would be credited for the fund transfer trade. The magnifying glass icon displays the Call and notice and settlement accounts setup in the treasury back office for the customer. Note: If you select the Credit Account without selecting the entity, then an error message is displayed indicating that the user must first select the entity.

Enter the currency and the amount that needs to be transferred. You can either enter a currency code or select the payment currency from the magnifying glass icon. If an incorrect currency code is entered by the customer, then the following error message is displayed: Currency xxx is not defined as a valid currency. You can enter an amount in the Amount field. Numeric. An error message is displayed if the value entered is not numeric. Supports two places after decimal. If a value entered has more than two places after decimal, then the following error message is displayed: Value entered is not valid. You can either enter
A decimal value is not a valid value for the JPY currency. You can click the magnifying glass icon to select the Payment currency from the existing list.

entry.para: Settlement date of the fund transfer request. Enter a specific date. The dropdown list displays the following values from the Value Date field: Days, Date, Months, Weeks, Years, CASH, SPOT, and TOM.

When you select any of the values, a blank field is displayed adjacent to the Request Date field. If you select Date, the adjacent field has a dropdown calendar to enable you to select the date. You can select the date from the calendar in the adjacent field. If you select Days, then you must specify a valid business day for the entered currency or currency pair. If you select SPOT, then value date is two business days from the current date. If you select CASH, then the value date is the current date. If you select TOM, the value date is one business day from the current date. If a date less than today is selected, then the following error message is displayed: Request Date must be greater than or equal to today. The value can be entered in date format or as a pre-defined period (For example, 6 Months or 2 Years).

section.title: Edit Transactions
section.para: The Edit Transactions menu displays a list of fund transfer records that are created and saved, but not submitted to the bank. The records that are not submitted due to insufficient privileges are also saved and displayed in the Edit Transactions menu. You can review, modify, and submit these records. When this option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Treasury services > Wires and Transfer > FT Initiation > Edit Transactions, the List of Draft Treasury Fund Transfers page is displayed, it allows a fund transfer request that a user has already created and saved, to be completed. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter. Click the System ID column of the required entry to open it for further editing. For more information about the action buttons, refer to the Initiation - FT Wires section.

section.title: Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: The Retrieve Unsigned menu displays a list of fund transfer requests that have been created and saved by the users in the bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the treasury back office because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included. You can review and submit these records.

When this option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Treasury services > Wires and Transfer > FT Initiation > Retrieve Unsigned, the List of Unsigned Treasury Fund Transfers page is displayed. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter. Click the System Id column of the required entry to open it in a non-editable mode to review the data and perform the submission. When clicked, the Users icon will display the user that created the transaction, and any users that have edited, authorized, or verified it. If there is sufficient authorization in the users' profile, multiple records can be submitted in a single operation directly from the list. You can use the check box to select the records that needs to be submitted. Click Submit to submit all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the treasury back office along with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is displayed. The Preview button enables you to see the deal summary and the Return button enables you to reject the trade and remove the transaction from the Retrieve Unsigned queue. For more information about the Submit, Return, Cancel, and Help action buttons, refer to the Initiation - FT Wires section.

section.title: Pending FTs
section.para: This function will display a list of all the FT trade records that have not been approved by the bank. These can be edited or submitted as required by any user with the appropriate authorities.

section.title: Pending FTs - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Pending FTs function from the toolbar, select Treasury Services > Wires and Transfers then select Pending FTs from the side left navigation menu. The List of Pending Treasury Fund Transfer Transactions page appears.

section.title: Pending FTs Selection
section.para: When this function is selected, the list of all the existing pending FT transactions is displayed. These transactions can be edited or submitted as required by any user with the appropriate authorities. Click the Search Options link to display a list of search criteria fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter. The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System ID, Entity, Product Type, Ccy, and Beneficiary Name fields. To display all the records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The following columns are returned for the list of Pending FTs:

entry.para: Field
Description
Unique reference number generated by for the FT trade request, when it was initiated.

row.entry: Entity mapped to the customer. This field is available only if your company has entities. This field is hidden if there are no entities mapped to the customer.

entry.para: Type of record. (New, Message Amend Instructions etc.)
Status of the record.
Customer's financial institution where the payment is made.
Currency of the transaction.
Amount of the fund transfer.
Type of the product.
Last modified date of the transaction.

section.para: Each record is shown with one or more action icons to the left of the entry, depending on its status. The Lookup button displays the Event Details, General Details, Applicant Details, Bank Details, Contract Details, and Settlement Details. The History button displays the history of the file. The history of the file includes the Consolidated Summary View and the Foreign Exchange Inquiry - History section. The View in Control Mode button displays an editable record in Control mode. (View only) . Only Draft and Incomplete (unauthorized) entries can be edited by clicking the Edit icon in the left hand column of the entry. The Open Draft Treasury Fund Transfer page is displayed. You can edit and submit the pending fund transfer record. For more information about the action buttons, refer to the Initiation - FT Wires section. You can only view the submitted entries.
There is also a download button that allows the results to be saved as a file on the executing PC. Click this button and select the required option from the list shown. The options are:

listitem.para: Spreadsheet downloads the list to the PC as MS-Excel file.
CSV downloads the list to the PC as Comma-Separated Values file.

section.para: Use the CSV option to export the list as a report allowing it to be customized further for various office productivity tools. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, save the file (default name is pendingIP.xxx) or directly open it to launch Excel if it is available on the workstation.

section.title: FT Inquiry
section.para: This function will display a list of all the FT trade records that have been submitted to the bank and accepted. These can only be viewed.

section.title: FT Inquiry - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the FT Inquiry function from the toolbar, select Treasury Services > Wires and Transfers, then select FT Inquiry - ALL from the side left navigation menu. The Inquiry - List of Treasury Fund Transfer Transactions page appears.

section.title: FT Inquiry Selection
section.para: When this function is selected, the list of all the Fund Transfer records that have been submitted to the bank and have been accepted by the bank is displayed. Click the Search Options link to display a list of search criteria fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter. The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Product Type, Bank Ref, Our Ref, Ccy, and Beneficiary Name fields. To display all the records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The following columns are displayed.

entry.para: Field
Description
Unique reference number generated by for the FT trade request, when it was initiated.
Treasury Back Office reference number that the bank uses to identify the FT trade.
Customer reference associated with the FT trade request.
Customer's financial institution where the payment is made.
Currency of the transaction
Amount of the fund transfer.
Type of the product.
Value date of the transaction.
Status of the transaction. By default, the value displayed is New.

section.para: Each record is shown with one or more action icons to the left of the entry, depending on its status. The Lookup button displays the Event Details, General Details, Applicant Details, Bank Details, Contract Details, and Settlement Details. The History button displays the history of the file. The history of the file includes the Consolidated Summary View and the Foreign Exchange Inquiry - History section.
There is also a download button that allows the results to be saved as a file on the executing PC. Click this button and select the required option from the list shown. The options are:

listitem.para: Spreadsheet downloads the list to the PC as MS-Excel file.
CSV downloads the list to the PC as Comma-Separated Values file.

section.para: Use the CSV option to export the list as a report allowing it to be customized further for various office productivity tools. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, save the file (default name is pendingIP.xxx) or directly open it to launch Excel if it is available on the workstation.

section.title: FT Maintenance
section.para: This function is used to maintain Fund Transfer trade records that were created but are no longer required in the system.

section.title: FT Maintenance - Set Entity
section.para: The Set Entity function lists all the Fund Transfer transactions and enables to associate an entity with the record. When you select the Set Entity function, the Update Treasury Fund Transfer Entities page appears. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Ccy, and Beneficiary Name fields. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter. A list of records is displayed. Click a record, the Change Treasury Fund Transfer Entity page appears. You can now associate an entity for the Fund Transfer trade. Select the entity using the magnifying class icon from the Entity field. Click the Submit button to complete the changes.

section.title: FT Maintenance - Set Reference
section.para: The Set Reference function allows you to assign a customer reference to a Fund Transfer record that currently has none. When you select the Set Reference function, the List of Treasury Fund Transfers without Customer Reference page appears. The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Ccy, and Beneficiary Name fields. You are presented with a list of records that have no reference assigned. Click in the System Id columnto open a form. The Change Treasury Fund Transfer Reference page appears. You can assign a reference to a record by entering a reference in the Reference field. Click the Submit button to complete the changes.

section.title: FT Maintenance - Unsigned FTs
section.para: The Unsigned FTs function lists and optionally deletes unsigned (unauthorized) Fund Transfer transactions. When you select the Unsigned FT function, the Maintenance of Treasury Fund Transfer Unsigned Transactions page appears. The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Product Type, Bank Ref, Our Ref, Beneficiary Name, and Ccy fields. When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that are unsigned (that is, unauthorized). You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. You can delete one or more records in a single operation by selecting the check box in the left side and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: FT Maintenance - Purged FTs
section.para: The Purged FTs function lists and optionally deletes Fund Transfer transactions that have been marked as purged by the treasury back office. When you select the Purged FTs function, the Maintenance of Treasury Fund Transfer Purged Transactions page appears. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Product Type, Bank Ref, Our Ref, Beneficiary Name, and Ccy fields. You are presented with a list of records. You can delete one or more records in a single operation by selecting the check box in the left side and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: FT Maintenance - Rejected FTs
section.para: The Rejected FTs lists and optionally deletes rejected transactions. When you select this option, the Maintenance of Treasury Fund Transfer Not-Issued Transactions page appears. The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity, Product Type, Bank Ref, Our Ref, Beneficiary Name, and Ccy fields. You are presented with a list of Fund Transfer records that were submitted but rejected by the bank. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. You can delete one or more records in a single operation by selecting the check box in the left side and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
There is also a download button that allows the results to be saved as a file on the executing PC. Click this button and select the required option from the list shown. The options are:

listitem.para: Spreadsheet downloads the list to the PC as MS-Excel file.
CSV downloads the list to the PC as Comma-Separated Values file.

section.para: Use the CSV option to export the list as a report allowing it to be customized further for various office productivity tools. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, save the file (default name is pendingIP.xxx) or directly open it to launch Excel if it is available on the workstation.

note.para: The Download File button appears only in the Update Treasury Fund Transfer Entities and List of Treasury Fund Transfers without Customer Reference page.
